alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:53PM CDT until March 26 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton, Fulton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 42.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM CDT Thursday was 43.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 29.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday evening at 1100 PM CDT.
